metadata.title: CVE-2017-2591 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
389-ds-base before version 1.3.6 is vulnerable to an improperly NULL terminated array in the uniqueness_entry_to_config() function in the "attribute uniqueness" plugin of 389 Directory Server. An authenticated, or possibly unauthenticated, attacker could use this flaw to force an out-of-bound heap memory read, possibly triggering a crash of the LDAP service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.0.18-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.0.18-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.0.18-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.0.18-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.0.18-1
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> the project changed its site. That's the current one: https://pagure.io/389-ds-base for commits from the older site, just copy the sha and paste with /c/<sha-commit>

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.0.18-1').
